comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: "Alexander Heinrich Rudolph von Kluck (Born 20 may 1846 in Münster, Westphalia, then to Prussia; died October 19 , 1934 in Berlin) was a Prussian General of the infantry and Army Chief Commander in the first world war." de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_von_Kluck Often blamed for the failure of Germany's Western Front offensive. Von Kluck's name was mentioned in a bawdy British army song, which in the original ran: "Kaiser Bill is feeling ill, The Crown Prince, he's gone barmy. We don't give a f*ck for old von Kluck And all his bleedin' army." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexander_von_Kluck A tinted version on Flickr:

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: artolog:  Thanks for the more complete information on von Kluck.  We'll include some of it next time we update our description.
